channel.title: Rares
channel.description:
Do you find servers that use the normal Runescape rares (party hats, h'weens, etc) more fun or servers that make their own rares and sometimes use the Runescape ones for other things (such as dress shops or monster drops)?
I prefer custom rares, just wanting some other opinions as I'm working on a server again.

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

^ Like something that usually goes unused in private servers, example castle wars armor :o

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Protip: Rare items don’t have to be the standard “party hat, h’ween mask, etc”. Any item can be made ‘Rare’ if you choose to do so. This makes distribution a lot easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I really don’t like the idea of having rares in the game, but I also hate the fact that players will miss out on having them. There are two problems you will face when deciding how to distribute them:

[ul][li]Means of distribution; amount to be dispersed and how they are dispersed[/li]
[li]Possible loss of players; people will certainly quit due to their anger of not receiving one, which is really no one’s fault, except for themselves for being in the wrong place at the right time[/li][/ul]

Handling this will be a good way to practice your management skills, because you will always have to make tough decisions, in which not everyone will agree.

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

runescape sucks:

I’ve had servers where we didn’t have “rares”, but yet we had uncommon items from bosses such as godwars items.

I think that’s in every economy server now, despite the items being pretty common

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:19, topic:462885”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=566129.msg4131841#msg4131841 date=1351195524]

For froyoscape, I plan on throwing rares out in holidays. Such hween mask for halloween.

Drop halloween masks all over rs, ya know. Like how rs introduced them to game. In the 2002 Hallowe’en event, Halloween masks were dropped all around RuneScape, and came in 3 different colours: red, blue and green.

That sounds great and all, but at that time, nobody knew what the masks were, nor did they know they contained ANY value. Now everybody knows those items possess a high amount of value in them. You’ll probably have to make a custom item (which a lot of people dislike). You could dump a new item from a newer cache, call it a ‘rare’, and make it the reward for the halloween event.
[/quote]

I’m going to make something like rs. It’s not gonna be exact, but it’s gonna be like that time. Like, I can drop other things and such.[/quote]
He was saying that it’s not much of a rare considering everyone who plays rs knows what the masks are, witch is why I want to stray away from using the traditional rares, they’re too overused and people know they’re valuable. I wouldn’t mind using partyhats for like the Drop party room or something, that might be kind of interesting, but they would be super common, like getting them out of a crate for free.

You shouldn’t announce that they’re rare though, just post that they’re discontinued in a future update, that way people won’t instantly start selling them for more than the entire economy each.

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

I have a plan on partyhats, actually, this might not even work, but I plan on giving out chefs hats as a rare item, and can later be turned into a partyhat with 99 crafting and a certain dye color, though that would probably make them all the same prices, unless I do something to make the dyes rare too. I don’t know why, but I like it, especially considering that no one would suspect that you get partyhats that way, or maybe you shape it like a Christmas cracker, then enchant it or something like that, from there open it up, I think that would be better considering that different phat colors would have different prices

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:9, topic:462885”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=566129.msg4123674#msg4123674 date=1350101508]

It all depends on how scarce you make the item. If something useful were hard to get it would become rare. Most servers just generically call partyhats “rares” and end up with everyone in the game having them, which would make them not rare at all. I would suggest using them for costumes and such, and making some more useful items rare, like a draconic visage or such (depending on the revision).

But that’s just my opinion.

Yeah, I want partyhats to be obtained though a quest I’m working on. I’m just trying to brainstorm some ideas for some items that would be the literal ‘rare’ and only obtainable for a limited time. I know this can be a bad idea in some cases, but it’s also just a nice vanity as compared to everything being obtained from donations, monster drops, etc.
[/quote]

[quote]the literal ‘rare’ and only obtainable for a limited time.[/quote] Do you mean event based, like over a holiday such as Christmas? Or do you mean like a consumable. You could always try work with a consumable, such as a ‘rare’ fish or elixir that you could give some bonuses or something cool which would make the player want to either use it for their benefit or sell it as a ‘rare’ to someone else who will use it.

You could also make like a golden hammer a 1 time use item that is used to craft something. Just throwing some suggestions out. I have thought a lot about all this and thought I might share some since I haven’t really been motivated to start anything for myself due to my depression, I’ve just had no motivation for anything. But if you need to ask anything just hit me up an inbox and I’ll get around to it sooner or later.[/quote]
More than likely though holidays or something similar,yeah

Read full topic

I know this can be a bad idea in some cases, but it’s also just a nice vanity as compared to everything being obtained from donations, monster drops, etc.[/quote]

the literal 'rare' and only obtainable for a limited time.
Do you mean event based, like over a holiday such as Christmas? Or do you mean like a consumable. You could always try work with a consumable, such as a 'rare' fish or elixir that you could give some bonuses or something cool which would make the player want to either use it for their benefit or sell it as a 'rare' to someone else who will use it.

You could also make like a golden hammer a 1 time use item that is used to craft something. Just throwing some suggestions out. I have thought a lot about all this and thought I might share some since I haven’t really been motivated to start anything for myself due to my depression, I’ve just had no motivation for anything. But if you need to ask anything just hit me up an inbox and I’ll get around to it sooner or later.

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You need to adjust the rares to your player base, make everything just about impossible to get in the beginning, don’t even bother making dragon claws a drop IMO if you don’t have their power lowered, and make party hats obtainable from some party oriented mini-games maybe? Just a suggestion.

Read full topic

item.title: Rares
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Team_Rocket:

Our universal “Hearthstone” teleport is the Disk of Returning. It’s the only way to teleport besides a Ring of Life. Thought It’d be cool to do something like this with a Rare item and I’ve never gotten any negative feedback.

I would have never thought of something like that.

OT: If the item blends in with the game and isn’t completely purposeless, then I wouldn’t mind. If there is a huge variety of items I would most likely dislike it.

Read full topic
